intro: Bupleurum tenuissimum f. normale, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a delicate, fern-like appearance. This species is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
